title: Best food events around Boston and New England for fall 2025
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: The Big E in West Springfield features diverse food vendors from Sept. 12-28, including fried, baked, and regional specialties.
The Vermont Wine & Harvest Festival, Sept. 19-20, offers a Grand Tasting with over 70 vendors and a scenic Vermont foliage view.
Wellfleet OysterFest on Oct. 18-19 celebrates oysters with raw bars, culinary demos, and family activities in Wellfleet, Massachusetts.

title: Emmy nominee Jeff Hiller joins the latest episode of the Love Letters podcast
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: Jeff Hiller, known for HBO's 'Somebody Somewhere', discusses a personal breakup story on the Love Letters podcast.
Hiller shares insights from his 20s about falling for someone who didn't treat him well, reflecting on universal love themes.
The episode includes discussions on famous romantic films like 'When Harry Met Sally' and 'Notting Hill'.

title: Lynn man charged in kidnapping, murder of older sister
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Joshua Smith, 30, from Lynn, charged with kidnapping and murdering his 38-year-old sister, Michelle Knox.
Smith pleaded not guilty in Lynn District Court; case files are sealed and unavailable to the public.
Smith previously pleaded guilty to assault with a dangerous weapon; other past charges include acquittals in 2020.

title: Patriots captain believes defense showed ‘glimpse of dominance’ vs. Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots captain Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks, playing a key role in the defense against the Raiders.
New England's defense, with key offseason signings like Landry and Williams, pressured Raid QB Smith but allowed 362 passing yards.
Despite showing potential in pass rush, the Patriots aim to improve defensive consistency before facing the Dolphins next week.

title: David Andrews believes this was most disappointing part of Patriots’ season-opening loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Andrews criticized the Patriots' run game after a 20-13 loss to the Raiders at Gillette Stadium.
The Patriots only managed 60 rushing yards on 18 attempts, emphasizing the passing game instead with 46 attempts.
Offensive line struggles contributed to the ineffective run game, failing to create opportunities for Stevenson and Henderson.

title: Marco Sturm maps out the standard he’s setting for Bruins’ training camp
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marco Sturm prepares for his first training camp as Boston Bruins head coach, set to begin September 17.
Sturm emphasizes a new standard focusing on intensity, accountability, and effort for a retooling Bruins roster.
Improving defense and power play are key goals, with emphasis on a bounce-back season for Jeremy Swayman.

title: Worcester girl testifies against man accused of kidnapping her, throwing her off bridge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Worcester girl testifies against Joshua Hubert, accused of kidnapping and attempted murder dating back to 2017.
Hubert, a family friend, allegedly raped and threw the girl into Lake Quinsigamond from a bridge.
Case has been delayed since 2020; trial commenced with opening statements; Court TV denied request to air.

title: Drake Maye doesn’t think he has ‘too much on his plate’ and more from WEEI interview
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye discussed his performance in the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders, completing 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards.
Maye acknowledged the need to improve decision-making after a pivotal interception in the third quarter impacted the game's momentum.
Maye addressed Bill Belichick's decision to ban a Patriots scout from UNC practices, saying it's Belichick's program to manage.

title: ‘Game 1 is always the hardest’: Patriots veteran shares perspective on Will Campbell’s debut
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell faced challenges in his debut, contributing to four team sacks and two false start penalties.
Veteran right-tackle Morgan Moses advised Campbell, emphasizing the learning curve and difficulty of NFL opening games.
Patriots' offense continues to struggle with a 13-point performance, echoing last season's scoring issues.

title: Kayshon Boutte reflects on his forgotten history as an elite prospect
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kayshon Boutte, once compared to Stefon Diggs, was a top-40 high school recruit before injuries affected his college career.
Boutte had a breakout game for the Patriots with six catches for 103 yards in the season opener, showing potential from his LSU days.
Boutte overcame being a sixth-round pick and injuries, establishing himself as a key receiver for New England by his third NFL season.
